Under the gleaming icons stood a long invalid chair, and in that chair on snowy-white smooth pillows, evident- ly freshly changed, Pierre saw covered to the waist by a bright green quiltthe familiar, ma- jestic figure of his father, Count Beziikhov, with that gray mane of hair above his broad forehead which reminded one of a lion, and the deep characteristically noble wrinkles of his handsome, ruddy face.
